intro: Carex sudetica, commonly known as the Sudetic sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and dense, spike-like inflorescences. This plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. Carex sudetica is native to Central and Eastern Europe, including parts of the Czech Republic, Germany, and Poland. It plays an important role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
